name: ai-automation-tool
description: AI-powered LinkedIn post automation tool for software engineers

scripts.dev: npm run kill && concurrently --kill-others-on-fail --prefix "[{name}]" --names "frontend,backend,ai" "npm run dev:frontend" "npm run dev:backend" "npm run dev:ai"
scripts.dev:all: npm run kill && concurrently --kill-others-on-fail --prefix "[{name}]" --names "frontend,backend,ai,scheduler" "npm run dev:frontend" "npm run dev:backend" "npm run dev:ai" "npm run dev:scheduler"
scripts.kill: npm run kill:ports && npm run kill:processes
scripts.kill:processes: pkill -f "node.*3001" || true && pkill -f "node.*3002" || true && pkill -f "vite" || true && pkill -f "nodemon" || true
scripts.restart: npm run kill && sleep 2 && npm run dev
scripts.build: npm run build:frontend && npm run build:backend
scripts.test: npm run test:frontend && npm run test:backend
scripts.lint: npm run lint:frontend && npm run lint:backend
scripts.status: echo "🔍 Checking service status..." && curl -s http://localhost:3001/health > /dev/null && echo "✅ Backend: Running on port 3001" || echo "❌ Backend: Not running" && curl -s http://localhost:3002/health > /dev/null && echo "✅ AI Service: Running on port 3002" || echo "❌ AI Service: Not running" && curl -s -I http://localhost:5173 > /dev/null && echo "✅ Frontend: Running on port 5173" || echo "❌ Frontend: Not running"
